item.title: Es un delito federal intimidar, amenazar o obligar a otra...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Es un delito federal intimidar, amenazar o obligar a otra persona con el fin de interferir con el derecho de esa persona a votar o elegir a cierta persona. La intimidaci√≥n de votantes puede ocurrir en cualquier lugar, no solo cerca de un lugar de votaci√≥n. No importa d√≥nde suceda, documente y reporte la intimidaci√≥n de votantes a sus funcionarios electos locales: https://bit.ly/3kvW748 y llame al 1-866-OUR-VOTE (1-866-687-8683) o al 1-888-VE-Y-VOTA (1-888-839-8682)

It is a federal crime to intimidate, threaten, or force another person in order to interfere with that person's right to vote or elect a certain person. Voter bullying can happen anywhere, not just near a polling location. No matter where it happens, document and report voter intimidation to your local elected officials: https://bit.ly/3kvW748 and call 1-866-OUR-VOTE (1-866-687-8683) or 1-888-VE-Y-VOTE (1-888-839-8682 ))TranslatedVisit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Election Day is tomorrow. Here are three things you can do to...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Election Day is tomorrow. Here are three things you can do to help others vote.
üó≥Ô∏è Coloradans can turn in up to 10 ballots in a general election on behalf of others. Ballots must be returned to a drop box the same day they are collected. Take a video of your ballot delivery so the person you're helping can rest easy.
üó≥Ô∏è Know your voting rights and share with others: https://www.aclu.org/know-your-rights/voting-rights/
üó≥Ô∏è Share the voter protection hotline to report voter suppression: 1-866-OUR-VOTE and 1-888-VE-Y-VOTA.

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Election Day is tomorrow! Here are three things to do if you...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Election Day is tomorrow! Here are three things to do if you haven't voted yet:

üó≥Ô∏èVote in-person: You can register the same day and receive voting assistance at a polling place near you.
üó≥Ô∏èFind your nearest ballot drop box, drive-through or in-person voting location at: https://justvotecolorado.org/.
üó≥Ô∏èUse the ACLU voter guide to help you navigate statewide ballot questions: aclu-co.org/voterguide

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: It is a federal crime to intimidate, threaten, or coerce another...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

It is a federal crime to intimidate, threaten, or coerce another person for the purpose of interfering with that person's right to vote or vote as they may choose. Voter intimidation can take place anywhere ‚Äî not just near a polling location. No matter where it happens, document and report voter intimidation to your local elected officials: https://bit.ly/3kvW748 And call 1-866-OUR-VOTE (1-866-687-8683) or 1-888-VE-Y-VOTA (1-888-839-8682)

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: The tragedy of this pandemic is worsened if we fail to learn the...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

The tragedy of this pandemic is worsened if we fail to learn the lessons COVID has taught us about a bloated and harmful carceral system that needlessly incarcerates thousands of Coloradans. We must act now to keep jail populations low and families together. Read the report: https://bit.ly/371MTZt
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Just moved? First time voter? Coloradans can register to vote up...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Just moved? First time voter? Coloradans can register to vote up to and on Election Day. If you need to register to vote or update your voter registration information, you can still do so in-person at a Voter Service and Polling Center in your county.

Don't forget to bring one of 16 acceptable forms of ID, including Medicaid cards and utility bills: https://www.sos.state.co.us/‚Ä¶/elections/vote/acceptableForm‚Ä¶

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Black and white people engage in pretrial misconduct at equal...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Black and white people engage in pretrial misconduct at equal rates. Yet Colorado's risk assessment tools categorize Black people as "high risk" 50% more often. As a result, Black people are more likely to be incarcerated pretrial. End this racist system. Read more: https://bit.ly/2G5RqyK

Bring Our Neighbors Home Bring Our Neighbors Home is a multi-year, community-driven campaign to ensure that poverty is not a crime and the presumption of innocence is more than theory. Every day, over 13,000 of our neighbors languish in Colorado‚Äôs ‚Ä¶ Continue reading ‚Üí

aclu-co.org

Pretrial Justice | ACLU of Colorado

Bring Our Neighbors Home Bring Our Neighbors Home is a multi-year, community-driven campaign to ensure that poverty is not a crime and the presumption of innocence is more than theory. Every day, over 13,000 of our neighbors languish in Colorado‚Äôs ‚Ä¶ Continue reading ‚ÜíBring Our Neighbors Home Bring Our Neighbors Home is a multi-year, community-driven campaign to ensure that poverty is not a crime and the presumption of innocence is more than theory. Every day, over 13,000 of our neighbors languish in Colorado‚Äôs ‚Ä¶ Continue reading ‚Üí

item.title: Ballot selfies? In Colorado, you have the right to take a...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Ballot selfies? In Colorado, you have the right to take a picture of your ballot, whether you have voted or not. It's your choice to share who you voted for or how you voted.

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Denver is threatening public health by arbitrarily designating...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Denver is threatening public health by arbitrarily designating public works cleanups without community support. Decisions about people experiencing homelessness should never be made without the input of people experiencing homelessness.

Story by Robert Davis Photos by Giles Clasen The ACLU of Colorado has notified the Denver City Attorney‚Äôs Office (CAO) that the City is violating the terms of the Lyall settlement and threatening public health by arbitrarily designating two former homeless camp sites for ‚Äúregular public works cl

denvervoice.org

ACLU says City‚Äôs Regular Public Works Cleanups Violate Lyall Settlement ‚Äî The Denver VOICE

Story by Robert Davis Photos by Giles Clasen The ACLU of Colorado has notified the Denver City Attorney‚Äôs Office (CAO) that the City is violating the terms of the Lyall settlement and threatening public health by arbitrarily designating two former homeless camp sites for ‚Äúregular public works clStory by Robert Davis Photos by Giles Clasen The ACLU of Colorado has notified the Denver City Attorney‚Äôs Office (CAO) that the City is violating the terms of the Lyall settlement and threatening public health by arbitrarily designating two former homeless camp sites for ‚Äúregular public works cl
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Risk assessment tools are used to decide who remains in jail....
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Risk assessment tools are used to decide who remains in jail. The stakes couldn't be higher. Yet our research shows that they're dangerous, ineffective and racist. We can't automate decisions around liberty and freedom. Read the ACLU letter released today: https://bit.ly/2G5RqyK
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: We must take action to bring our neighbors safely home or more...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

We must take action to bring our neighbors safely home or more people will die behind bars and in the community. Safe decarceration should be part of Governor Jared Polis's plan to protect public health. It's necessary and possible, here's how: https://acluco-wpengine.netdna-ssl.com/‚Ä¶/aclu_decarceration‚Ä¶

https://www.denverpost.com/‚Ä¶/colorado-prison-inmate-dies-c‚Ä¶/

Four men incarcerated in Colorado‚Äôs prisons have died after contracting COVID-19.

denverpost.com

A fourth Colorado inmate has died after experiencing COVID-19 symptoms

Four men incarcerated in Colorado‚Äôs prisons have died after contracting COVID-19.Four men incarcerated in Colorado‚Äôs prisons have died after contracting COVID-19.
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: The harms of eviction run deep. That's why we're...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

The harms of eviction run deep. That's why we're fighting alongside the No Eviction Without Representation campaign and housing justice advocates to challenge unjust evictions. With or without a global pandemic, fair access to housing is a legal right.

Boulder may not be an epicenter of COVID-19 infections, but the virus and economic fallout are upending lives all the same. Almost 20,000 Boulder residents have lost their jobs since March, and thousands of towns and cities across the country face similar circumstances. With moratoriums on evictions...

boulderweekly.com

Tenants have rights in eviction court. NEWR makes sure they can use them. - Boulder Weekly

Boulder may not be an epicenter of COVID-19 infections, but the virus and economic fallout are upending lives all the same. Almost 20,000 Boulder residents have lost their jobs since March, and thousands of towns and cities across the country face similar circumstances. item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: COVID-19 cases are on the rise in Colorado. Do your part by...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

COVID-19 cases are on the rise in Colorado. Do your part by filling out your ballot at home and returning it to a drop box. Keep in-person polls open for those who need it, like first-time voters, voters who need assistance, and your neighbors who work multiple jobs.

Find your nearest drop box and drive-through* voting locations: https://www.sos.state.co.us/pubs/elections/VIP.html

*Not available in all counties.

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Quarantine puppy ate your ballot? Whether your ballot was...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Quarantine puppy ate your ballot? Whether your ballot was damaged, or you made a mistake while voting at home, you have the right to a replacement ballot ‚Äî as long as you haven't returned the damaged ballot. Contact your county clerk to get a replacement ballot or go vote in-person. Be sure to destroy your damaged ballot.
Contact your county clerk: https://www.sos.state.co.us/‚Ä¶/Re‚Ä¶/CountyElectionOffices.html
Find in-person voting location: https://justvotecolorado.org/

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Over two million Americans spend each night behind bars. Mass...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Over two million Americans spend each night behind bars. Mass incarceration is an unbearable burden that traumatizes incarcerated people, families and communities. In the face of a global pandemic, thousands of Coloradans have been released. Now we must act to keep our neighbors home. Read our report: https://aclu-co.org/campaigns/covid-19-decarceration/

item.title: Immigration detention centers are designed to make profits and...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Immigration detention centers are designed to make profits and cause harm. GEO‚Äôs Aurora facility is no exception. No amount of window dressing and revisionist history will ever cover up the years of abuse and neglect our neighbors have endured in Aurora.

ICE facility is dangerously unsafe, unsanitary, unnecessary Re: ‚ÄúAurora‚Äôs ICE facility is a safe, clean and necessary facility,‚Äù Oct. 7 commentary

item.title: Amendment 76 is another racist attack on immigrants who are...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Amendment 76 is another racist attack on immigrants who are facing discrimination, abuse, and human rights violations at the hands of our current administration. Help protect immigrants from the hateful agenda of Amendment 76 and stand up for voting accessibility. Vote NO on 76!

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

item.title: La Enmienda 76 es otro ataque racista contra inmigrantes que...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

La Enmienda 76 es otro ataque racista contra inmigrantes que enfrentan discriminaci√≥n, abuso y violaciones de derechos humanos a manos de nuestra administraci√≥n actual. Ayude a proteger a los inmigrantes de la odiosa agenda de la Enmienda 76 y defienda la accesibilidad al voto. Vota NO a la 76!

Amendment 76 is another racist attack on immigrants facing discrimination, abuse and human rights violations at the hands of our current administration. Help protect immigrants from the hateful agenda of Amendment 76 and defend accessibility to vote. Vote NO at 76!Translated
